name: Brooklyn Diner
address: 155 W 43rd St, New York, NY 10036, USA

reviews.text: This is a must do for breakfast for us when we visit NYC. Interesting menu items. They are all delicious. Generous portions. Super friendly & attentive servers. My mimosa was the perfect shade of pale.
Long waiting time to order even though the restaurant was not crowded, but friendly staff.
Great service  , food well prepared  lovely staff
Ø·Ù„Ø¨Øª ÙˆØ¬Ø¨Ù‡ Ù…ÙƒØ³ÙŠÙƒÙŠÙ‡ Ù…ÙƒØ³ Ø±Ø² Ù…Ø¹ Ø¯Ø¬Ø§Ø¬ Ùˆ Ø³Ù„Ø·Ù‡ Ùˆ Ø§ÙˆÙÙˆÙƒØ§Ø¯Ùˆ Ù„Ø°ÙŠØ°Ù‡ .
Great little American Diner right near  Times Square, we had 2 great meals here. The staff and service were really good and the food was very tasty.

Great atmosphere and quick seating. Food arrived quickly but was luke warm at best. Pancake was tough. I really wanted to like this place since it was so cute and friendly. $30 for mediocre breakfast for one.

The food was good, but I realized for the price, the portions were quite small compared to other places. The waitress was not attentive to our table but she seemed nice at first. Once I went to pay, she forced me to leave a tip of 20/22/ or 25% and she made me feel super uncomfortable and upset to be honest. She said that "We work for tips only and these are your options to choose from" while there is other options such as custom/no tip options.  I am super disappointed and most likely will not be going back. I have never in my life had a waitress tell me I HAVE TO tip. (Was going to leave a tip, but she forced a bigger percentage). Would not recommend although the food was good.
The Brooklyn Diner is always our first and last stop in NYC. We stay right next door at the fabulous Casablanca Hotel. The diner is nice and the milkshake is a favorite.

A superb American dining experience.
Ashram, our waiter was very welcoming, friendly and attentive.
The breakfast was plentiful and tasty with endless coffee refills.
I thoroughly recommend a visit ğŸ‘ŒğŸ»ğŸ‘ŒğŸ»
We had a great time with my family, sitting outside in July. Itâ€™s a great spot to eat if you have a stroller. ğŸ‘¶ğŸ»ğŸ‘ğŸ¼â€¦
Our server saidou was excellent. The food was not good it was cold. The sausage was inedible very hard. Ordered sunny side up eggs and they was hard. I wouldn't come back for the breakfast.
Recommend the Eggs Benedict and the pancakes were fluffy and tasty
Everything was perfect, thank you for everything ğŸ˜Š

Very kind waiterâ€¦ delicious food and smalltalk.
Nice place to be and must do when visit Manhattan!!!! ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ğŸ‘ğŸ»
We had the Chocolate and Strawberry shakes and they were INCREDIBLE!
Busy place! Big portions and good taste. The pancakes were super fluffy.
The food is fantastic, great atmosphere and the service was excellent. I believe our servers name was Jessie and he was fantastic!
Great service and atmosphere but food was a bit bland

Brooklyn Diner is een klassiek Amerikaans restaurant waar je een heerlijke burger eet .
Gezellige inrichting en goede bediening.
Een aanrader om lekker te eten.

Mom and I eat at Brooklyn Diner every year when we visit NYC. Food is fantastic - great casual atmosphere. Yesterday, we had the pleasure of meeting Ash. He is absolutely the best - you know how you instantly feel comfortable with a person? Thatâ€™s how we felt meeting Ash. Kind, professional and compassionate.He enhanced our dining experience; he adds good into the world as a whole. â¤ï¸
My go to place for breakfast (I work in Times Square). Something for everyone - food is good, coffee is hot and plentiful. Staff are really lovely.

The Brooklyn Diner is a great place to eat and just one turn away from the overflown Times Square. The food tastes delicious and you have it in front of you mere minutes after ordering. While the service was also great, Yomaira was especially attentive and friendly, making sure I was happy and that I had everything I wanted or needed while there. Definitely recommend!
I had the Chinese salad with grilled shrimp; my daughter had the biscuit. Large portions! Tasty! We couldnâ€™t eat it all. Waiter provided great service!
They sit POC in the back
Everything turned out great.
The quality of your food is very good. I am truly satisfiedâ¤ï¸
Great restaurant near Times Square!
Nice diner for breakfast!! Great yogurt bowls. Also recommend pancakes or eggs!!
Mohammed provided excellent service
Mohammed did an excellent job of service. Very attentive to his customers. Service was excellent, food was delicious.
Jâ€™ai adorÃ©, câ€™est trÃ¨s bon et service ok !
Must visit when in Manhattan. Also, Yomaira is a star
Ash was attentive! Good Food for breakfast
Ash was a delight!! Delicious food
Love it! The giant hot dog was delicious and the atmosphere is everything you could want from a diner.
Ash was fantastic.. had great brunch.. loved it
Ash was great.  Had a good lunch.  Best food in the city comes from Brooklyn
Ash was great personabe and professional.  Will def return
Ash was great dude is a goat greatest of all time waiter hall of fame he needs a raise
Ash was fantastic
Ash was amazing and so friendly!!!

Ash was
Great
Had a wonderful breakfast with Ash. Food was delicious and service was great!
Ash was very attentive.  Great breakfast!
Ash gave us great service along with the great breakfast.
Ash fantastique good and service!! Je recommande
Ash, was great
Ash esa great
Ash was amazing! Perfect spot for a quick but relaxed bite!

Our friends recommended this place and told us to ask for Ashâ€™s section.  He did not disappoint.
Very attentive and great menu recommendations !  We will be back!

Worst restaurant in New York. A place where everything is unsatisfactory. Never go, especially if you're Asian. A place where racism stops from the moment you walk in to the moment you walk out. A penny tip is a waste here.

Stopped in to grab some takeout to bring back to our hotel.  I have a garlic allergy so Iâ€™m somewhat of a pain in the neck.  I was directed to go to the bar to order.  Leslie R. helped me out and was very kind.  I told her what I was interested in and she went up to the kitchen to check with the chef if either option (chicken soup and chicken fingers) were safe for me.  She came down and let me know both were safe so I ordered both.  Yes, itâ€™s 92* in July  ğŸ¥µ but I am SO glad I ordered the soup.  It is LOADED with tender chicken, celery, onions, carrots, and small noodles.
I will definitely be visiting this place before we head home. I want to mention again how kind and welcoming Leslie was.  She offered me to sit and a glass of water while I waited.
I havenâ€™t broken into the chicken fingers yet but they look delicious!  Stop inâ€¦you wonâ€™t be disappointed!

Restaurant dÃ©couvert le jour de notre arrivÃ©e et ce sera lÃ  pour le breakfast et le dÃ®ner. Tous les plats sont gÃ©nÃ©reux, dÃ©licieux et bien prÃ©sentÃ©s. Service rapide, serveurs souriants. Pourboire libre et acceptÃ© avec le sourire, peu importe le montant. TrÃ¨s bien

First time going, loved the atmosphere. Server was not super attentive , had to be waived down almost every time . The hostess and host were very kind very professional! Food was decent!  If you love a thick cakey pancake this is the place for you! I will say the â€œfriesâ€ are just small cut up potatoes but they are very good!!

Quality of eating perfect. Quality of service less than 0. In front of Europe, English is not my first language. The waitress kept trying to correct my language and accent the whole time. It felt very arrogant. This was the first restaurant I visited in the USA. There was a lot of confusion about tipping, which doesnâ€™t feel natural to me. I wanted to leave 10%, and I suddenly felt a lot of hostility from the waitress. I also didnâ€™t really understand why I wasnâ€™t allowed to take the receipt with me. Apart from that, the food was actually of very high quality.

This was the best dining experience that I can recall ever having. There was no wait time. Staff were extremely kind and accommodating. Outstanding service was consistent as I dined on two occasions at dinner time. I cannot say enough good things about the Brooklyn Diner and will have to make it a stop on every trip to New York

I went here this evening with my wife for dinner, right from the moment we stepped in we were greeted with a warm welcome, our server was Gabriela who remembered us from our last visit here, and not only was she very attentive but also quite insightful about portion size of the delicious chicken pot pie (which is a must try by the way) and recommended that we only get one as that would be sufficient for two people, and instead suggested that we try the Korean spicy burger which again was a delight to our senses. All in all my wife and I were really happy with Gabrielaâ€™s service. Thanks!

I went tonight with my husband for dinner and we received a very warm welcome from the entire staffğŸ˜. Our server was Gabriela who was also our server from three months ago and she remembered us instantlyğŸ¥¹. This made our evening! She was on point with everything , and the service was outstanding as usual. She was very friendly towards me and made me feel very specialğŸ¤ I cannot recommend her enough! Thanks GabrielağŸ¥°

ğŸ¥³Fantastic Breakfast at USA Brooklyn Delicatessen Times SquareğŸ˜

Had an amazing breakfast at USAâ€¯Brooklyn Delicatessen in Timesâ€¯SquareğŸ˜ŠWe ordered eggs over light with softly cooked bacon, a veggie egg white omelette, and fresh coffee â€” everything was absolutely delicious and made to perfectionğŸ‘The eggs were fluffy, the bacon melt-in-your-mouth tender, and the omelette was packed with fresh ingredientsâ¤ï¸The coffee was rich and satisfying â€” exactly what you want to start the day in the Big ğŸ The atmosphere was casual and welcoming, and the staff were friendly and efficient. Highly recommend for a hearty, no-fuss breakfast near Timesâ€¯SquareğŸ˜˜
Had the quinoa salad and the flavor was incredible.  Best salad i have had. Husband had the fish and chips. Says it was crunchy and hot very good. The waiter was fantastic. Although I forgot his name

Ein tolles Diner!
Es ist wirklich schÃ¶n eingerichtet und sehr gemÃ¼tlich. Die Kellner sind sehr aufmerksam und zuvorkommend. Die Preise sind angemessen, wie Ã¼berall in New York.

Unsere Essen war sehr lecker und reichlich. Aber am besten war der Oreo Milchshake. Der war mega gut.
Ich kann dieses Diner sehr empfehlen!

We arrived without reservations and were sat immediately. Service was prompt, courteous, and attentive. Our food came out fairly quickly, as ordered. It was delicious.  The atmosphere is nice and pleasant.  The prices were not ridiculously high considering it was next to Times Square.  I would return.

Great place near the Times Square. We just walked in without reservation and there were some empty spots. Dinery is cozy, not too loud. For the 1 slice of chocolate cake and 1 portion of omelet we paid $45 with tips. The prices are all bit higher but again it's the heart of Manhattan so.....
The portion is not too big.
In general recommend ğŸ‘Œ

Our Server T was incredible nothing was to much trouble for her at all!! Coffee refills were just at the right time as if she had a third sense for it. She checked back at just the right moments as well, anyone would be lucky to be served by her! She truly was the star of the Dinner.

What a great experience! We're no stranger to great diners so it takes a lot to get me to write a review. The Brooklyn Diner hit the spot in so many respects. From the great atmosphere to the service... Our visit this morning was a breath of fresh air in a city that pushes everything too fast

Our server Toniah, was fast and detail oriented. Our breakfast arrived hot, perfectly cooked, and served with skill. I had 3 eggs over medium with fries and homemade sausage (my typical order). They did not disappoint.

It's a pity I'm not in town more often because I'd make this place a regular stop.

Great with kids and the floor is run with speed so you're not waiting all day for a table. This place is tops.

I was there for a late night dinner with my two daughters last Friday night. The staff is cheerful, efficient and polite. The place, although little dark inside with the wood paneling, is very clean, no dust to be seen anywhere. The Caesar salad was outstanding and the guacamole tasted almost as good as homemade, it was the perfect midnight snack!

With scaffolding over the entrance, the first impression, due to no fault of its own, is not impressive to the eye. But once inside this nice size diner, one realizes that the place is attractive (see my photos).
UPDATED REVIEW:
At one o'clock in the afternoon, I ordered from the area of the menu which says, " breakfast all day."  I had three scrambled eggs, small cubed home fries, ham and challah bread. Jelly and Greenland salted butter came on the side with the order. They have a new chef whose home fries I did not care for. Instead of putting bread on a plate of its own, they put the bread on the plate with the eggs, thereby giving you a SMALL amount of home fries or its alternative French fries. The cost was, including tax, $24 + tip. It was the optional ham cost that brought the price to that level. They offer the eggs with an option to add Nova smoked salmon on the side, as was the ham. I had their coffee and enjoyed it. After leaving the above review about the eggs, I went back and had their oatmeal which was watery. It had a lot of fruit on it, but the preparation of the oatmeal, which should not be watery, was poor. My photos include the restaurant's framed image of the Brooklyn Dodger's Ebbets Field stadium and a flag landmark seen near the restaurant. I have included in my photos a number of different areas of the diner, including the bar where you can order from the menu being served at the tables.

The only reason the food didn't get 5 stars was the waffles. They are dry and not very tasty. However, the Pastrami Hash and Eggs and the Egg Biscuits were so delicious. The environment was chill and the diner is really  cute. The bathrooms are clean as well and the mouthwash was full.

I had been looking for a good diner to eat at for a long time and hadn't been able to find it until I came to this one. The atmosphere feels like an American diner from the 80's, with good music and a well maintained design. I want to say Tania, she was the one who took my order and was very cordial and respectful to us. And finally, the best: the food. I ordered the Home Run Breakfast and it was delicious. The taste of the pancakes, potatoes, scrambled eggs and sausage was a pleasant surprise that I had been looking for for a long time and I finally found it. Congratulations to the whole team and I hope you keep making good food!

Tried this place before a show.  Good diner food.  The 15 bite hot dog was huge and tasty, the sauerkraut was good too, I couldâ€™ve used some more of it.  The onion rings were ok.  The milkshake was great though!

This is such a great diner in the heart of Times Square. I dined here several times for breakfast while playing "tourist" with my most recent visit this past weekend. The staff here is fantastic. My server Tonia was friendly and very attentive. The breakfast menu was limited but has pretty good options and can seem quite costly. I ordered the vegetable frittata with the home fries, and it tasted great and had a good flavor. Coffee here is really good, too. The establishment is clean and appears more elegant inside than your average diner in spite of the outside looking retro. I really enjoyed the meals I have had here so far, and I definitely recommend that anyone visiting, whether local or not, to check this place out.

It was our first dinner in NY just near our hotel and this is exactly what you need after a long flight ! Typical American food, including all day breakfast (my dream!). The prices are fine for the area, the food is delicious and generous, the service is fast and the design makes you feel like you are in an American movie. Special thanks to our waiter Cheikh for being so friendly and welcoming, his professionalism makes us want to come back. And we will! Thank you so much Cheikh!

After years I return to this diner for Thanksgiving. Always a positive and excellent experience. I booked in advance to have a guaranteed table and I enjoyed an excellent menu based on turkey and pumpkin pie. Delicious, excellent. Absolutely recommended. I will return again.

Dopo anni ritorno in questo diner per il giorno del ringraziamento. Esperienza sempre positiva e ottima. Ho prenotato in anticipo per avere il tavolo garantito e ho gustato un ottimo menÃ¹ a base di tacchino e torta di zucca. Squisito, eccellente. Assolutamente consigliato. Ci tornerÃ² nuovamente.

We were going to eat at an Italian restaurant nearby but there was a 45 minute wait. There was no wait at the Brooklyn Diner so we gave it a try. We are glad we did. The restaurant is more upscale than a typical diner but the atmosphere is very relaxed. The staff is friendly and our server did an excellent job. She answered our questions and checked on us enough, but not too much.  The food was delicious. I had a basic cheeseburger but it was cooked perfectly and the toppings were as fresh as could be. A table next to us had the chicken pot pie - it looked amazing. A wide ranging menu that has something for everyone. The food arrived quickly and the meal went smoothly. We liked it so much we stopped in after a play the next night. Great service, nice atmosphere, no wait and delicious food. All at a reasonable price. A rarity for New York. If you are in the Times Square area and looking for a good restaurant, you should give the Brooklyn Diner a look.
Loved it!! The food, the service, the environment, everything was perfect! I can recommend the French royale breakfast and Pastrami hash with fried eggs â˜ºï¸
Wanted a quick and good meal. Landed here at Brooklyn Diner and Gabriela did an amazing job taking care of us. Recommend the half chicken and it was delicious. Thank you for a wonderful time.

I just had to leave a review for this diner! While exploring the city, my boyfriend and I stopped by Brooklyn Diner on a whim and it was a decision well made. We were seated right away, and our food arrived quickly. One bite was enough to make my day! I got the BBQ burger, and my boyfriend had the popular hot pastrami sandwich, both were amazing. On top of that, the staff was super attentive and friendly. Highly recommend!

A Colombian influencer recently posted about this place, one of the best hot dogs in NYC ğŸ—½ so my husband and I went to try it.
Really good food, the sausage was amazing and the fries ğŸŸ were delicious. We ordered a salad too and it was really tasty. Highly recommended

Food not the best
Could be better with prices they have
Compared to some other Manhattan dinners.
Service was actually great and fast.
Atmosphere,hm..so so

â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸

We had such a great experience at Brooklyn Diner in Times Square. From the moment we sat down, Gabriella made the night memorable. She was warm, attentive, and made us feel welcome without ever rushing us. Every recommendation she gave was spot-on, and you could tell she genuinely cared about making sure we enjoyed ourselves.

The food was just as impressive. Everything came out fresh, flavorful, and perfectly cooked. Itâ€™s rare to find a place in such a busy part of the city that feels both lively and comfortable, but Brooklyn Diner pulls it off.

A special thank-you to Gabriella for going above and beyondâ€”she turned a good meal into a great night.

My recent visit to Brooklyn Diner at Times Square was an absolute delight from start to finish. This spot truly excels in every aspect, making it a must-visit for anyone looking for a fantastic dining experience in New York City.The food was simply outstanding. Every dish that came to our table was prepared with care and packed with flavor. A definite highlight, and something I'd highly recommend, is their classic hot dog. It's truly amazing â€“ perfectly cooked with that satisfying snap, and just the right balance of savory goodness. And to complement the delicious food, the spicy margarita was a revelation; it had the perfect kick and was incredibly refreshing.Beyond the food, the service was impeccable. The staff were attentive, friendly, and went above and beyond to ensure a comfortable and enjoyable meal. Their efficiency and warm demeanor truly enhanced the overall experience.Finally, the vibe of the Brooklyn Diner is excellent. It strikes a wonderful balance, offering a lively yet comfortable atmosphere that makes you feel right at home. Whether you're there for a quick bite or a leisurely meal, the ambiance perfectly complements the delicious food and top-notch service.In summary, Brooklyn Diner at Times Square delivers on all fronts: excellent food (especially that classic hot dog and spicy margarita!), superb service, and a wonderful atmosphere. I can't wait to go back!

I stopped in for lunch first but the greeter mentioned Iâ€™d be rushed since I was trying to make a 1pm Broadway show.  He recommended their sister property which was a great choice for a quicker meal.
I came back for dinner and the Chinese salad was delicious!  Gabriela, my waitress, was kind and attentive without being bothersome.  Great spot to eat before a Broadway show!
Service was great and the place is nice but the food was just ok and pricey for the quality. I did like that they had a breakfast meal that included orange juice and coffee.

Our dining experience was enhanced by the attentive and accommodating waitstaff, who went out of their way to cater to our needs and preferences. They were particularly adept at managing dietary requirements, ensuring everyone in our party had a satisfying meal.

The menu offers a variety of delectable dishes, all expertly prepared and beautifully presented. The wine selection is also noteworthy, with knowledgeable staff ready to recommend the perfect pairing for your meal.

Overall, the combination of exceptional food, friendly service, and a chic, comfortable setting makes this place a standout choice for dinner in NYC. Highly recommended for anyone seeking an unforgettable dining experience.

While visiting NYC, my wife and I stopped off at this diner for breakfast. It wasnâ€™t overly busy, but we were seated quickly and the service was good. There was an authentic feel to the diner and it had a good atmosphere. Food was good. Certainly worth people giving this place a try.
